title: 1960s Psychedelic Rock
description: Turn on, tune in, and test your knowledge of the mind-expanding psychedelic rock era!

questions.question: Which San Francisco neighborhood became the epicenter of psychedelic rock culture in 1967?
Jefferson Airplane's 'White Rabbit' was inspired by which literary work?
Which Beatles album is widely considered their psychedelic masterpiece?
options: Sgt. Pepper's Lonely Hearts Club Band

questions.question: Which band featured Jim Morrison and recorded 'Light My Fire'?
Jimi Hendrix's 'Purple Haze' was released in what year?
Which San Francisco venue was the most famous psychedelic rock concert hall?
The Grateful Dead were closely associated with which countercultural author and his Acid Tests?
Which Jimi Hendrix Experience album included 'Are You Experienced' and 'Hey Joe'?
Which Beatles song was banned by the BBC for alleged drug references with the initials L.S.D.?
options: Lucy in the Sky with Diamonds

questions.question: Grace Slick was the vocalist of which psychedelic band?
options: Big Brother and the Holding Company

questions.question: Janis Joplin first gained fame as the singer for which psychedelic band?
options: Big Brother and the Holding Company

questions.question: What was the name of the 1967 cultural phenomenon known as the 'Summer of' what?
Which psychedelic rock band had the concept album 'Tommy' about a deaf, dumb and blind boy?
Which psychedelic poster artist created iconic concert posters for the Fillmore?
Cream, the psychedelic blues-rock power trio, featured which legendary guitarist?
